snippet: Youngstown officials want a chance to study data from a fresh earthquake in the area of an injection well, which disposes of wastewater from the hydraulic fracturing process.
abstract: Underground disposal of wastewater from natural-gas drilling operations will remain halted in Ohio's Youngstown area until scientists can analyze data from most recent string of earthquakes; scientists have said that waste from hydraulic fracturing process may have aggravated ancient fault line running under Youngstown, causing it to slip.
lead_paragraph: Youngstown officials want a chance to study data from a fresh earthquake in the area of an injection well, which disposes of wastewater from the hydraulic fracturing process.

headline.seo: Youngstown Injection Well Stays Shut After Earthquake
headline.main: Disposal Halted at Well After New Quake in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Disposal Halted at Well After New Quake in Ohio
